title: The La Prairie Line Interception Power Duo Is the Closest a Cream Has Come to Botox
text: January 24, 2017 Courtesy of brand There are retinol serums that thicken skin and regrow collagen . There are broad-spectrum sunscreens that can keep damage from happening in the first place. But until now, there hasn’t been a cream that could actually interfere with the frowny muscle contractions that make wrinkling—no matter how well you coddle your skin—inevitable. Until now. La Prairie just launched the new La Prairie Line Interception Power Duo, which goes where no cream has gone before. The night cream is nothing out of the ordinary: Collagen-stimulating peptides, hydrating ingredients. But the day cream by its side? Pretty impressive. Along with hyaluronic acid, it contains special peptides that actually interfere with your facial muscle’s ability to contract. Palmitoyl Hexapeptide-52 actually reduces the amount of neurotransmitters (calcium, acetylcholine, and sodium) that can get through the calcium channel through which your brain tells your muscles to contract. And Palmitoyl Heptapeptide-18 limit the channel's opening, so even fewer signaling molecules get through. In plain English: It lessens the strength of—but doesn't prevent—the contraction. So you’ll frown, but your brow won’t furrow as much. You May Also Like Skin Dermatologist Tips on How to Get Rid of Blackheads So, how is this similar to Botox ? Botulinum toxin blocks the same pathway but does so by destroying (for several months) a protein present at the nerve cell's ending. But this is the first skin-care product we've seen that does anything like it. A huge caveat, though: The Line Interception Power Duo's creators and dermatologists alike will tell you that it's not a replacement for Botox . If you want results of that magnitude (a major erasure of lines, rather than a softening) you'll have to go under the needle. More exciting skin-care launches:
